job_title: LATAM Internship Program - Solution Engineering Intern (México)
job_description:
• Life at Salesforce Our Locations Our Locations North America Europe, Middle East, and Africa Asia Pacific Latin America Our Teams Our Teams Sales Technology & Product Customer Success Corporate Roles AI Research University University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager Talent Programs Talent Programs Overview Future Pathways India Return to Work Military Fellows Create innovative, creative and intelligent solutions by developing in the Salesforce platform.
• Develop demonstration preparation skills and presentation skills.
• Org Sustainability Investors Give us your Feedback Sitemap Legal Terms of Service Privacy Information Responsible Disclosure Trust Contact Manage Preferences University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager 12 month internship.
• Design and build solutions using Salesforce solutions, both in declarative and programmatic manners.
• Develop and execute strategic projects that will help the Solution Engineering team in the long term.
• Provide support to the Solution Engineering team building demonstrations, prototypes, RFPs and other related activities.
• During the 2nd half of the program you’ll be able to participate in customer meetings and doing presentations as well as be part of Account planning processes.
• Our Story Newsroom Blog Careers Trust Salesforce.

• Prior software internship and/or machine learning research experience.
• Candidate should be good in technical problem solving and have excellent programming skills, ideally with prior software internship and/or machine learning research experience.
• Experience with Python, C/C++, and machine learning frameworks.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Studying towards degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering Location: Santa Clara, CA Onsite/Hybrid: : This role requires the student to work full time (40 hours a week), in a hybrid or onsite work structure throughout the duration of the co-op/intern term.
• Study state-of-the-art techniques for distributed machine learning training and inference, and implicit neural representations of images or videos.
• Evaluate software and hardware implementation aspects of these techniques and document findings.
• Identify/propose a set of techniques that are appropriate for AMD’s diverse HW/SW ecosystem.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
• In this role, you will play a key part in defining software requirements, designing embedded solutions, and verifying system performance, ensuring our maintenance systems meet the evolving needs of modern aircraft.
• The ideal candidate will bring hands‑on experience with system‑level testing, REST APIs, structured data formats, and embedded or IoT platforms to ensure the reliability, performance, and compliance of technologies deployed across mission‑critical environments worldwide.
• You’ll bridge engineering and IT to ensure complex aerospace development ecosystems perform at scale, meet rigorous standards, and align with regulatory and export‑controlled requirements.
• This position is ideal for engineers experienced in modern software development methodologies, debugging, and performance optimization, who thrive in highly technical, cross‑functional environments.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements You will report directly to our Senior Engineering Manager and you will work out of our Phoenix, AZ location on a Hybrid work schedule.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
